node.display_long_description:
Multiverse - Come in and experience our first domain: The Planetarium. Explore astronomy like never before - socially in VR with your friends.

Multiverse is an experience like no other. Learn about astronomy while navigating through awe-inspiring environments that showcase the solar system, its planets, their moons and other solar bodies.

Enter the Planetarium to discover mind-blowing images, videos and models, all rendered in stunning detail, with audio descriptions, toys and interactive exhibits.

Chat, fire off rockets, chase each other through the solar system, or play hide and seek behind Jupiter. Multiverse's focus on streaming and social interactions make this a social experience not to be missed.

Visit Stonehenge for the Summer Solstice

node.reviewDescription:
Has great potential with some really great presentations.

However frequently spoiled by groups of people (obviously kids) who have no interest in the topic and just get in the way twatting around making it impossible to follow the presentation. Impossible to ignore them and it just ruins the whole experience.

Why does everything have to be “Social”? What benefit is there to the “Social” aspect of this?

I really wish I could turn that off so I can follow the presentation without being constantly interrupted  by people who are only using it as a venue to meet each other.

I frequently leave in utter frustration.

Come on developers, give us the option of  real single player mode not just a incognito so we can actually watch the excellent presentations please!

developerResponse.body: Hi NagasQuest. Thanks for your review. There is an option in your wrist menu to go into "Safe Mode" - this will mute other players and allow you to explore The Planetarium in peace and queit.
